overview_of_class:
Jazz Dance has grown from roots of African rhythm and movement traditions, social dance, and Ballet. Jazz is recognized as the basis of most Musical Theatre dance, most commonly used in the commercial and entertainment industries. Jazz 2 class explores intermediate level technique, creative personal expression, and reaffirms alignment, technical principles, and stylistic variance. Isolated movement, extended work in demi-plié, and embodied syncopation, weight change, and rhythmic work will be the focus.
Moving through a range of Jazz dance styles, Lyrical, Classical, and Contemporary, the class will also address basic Ballet based technical skills, in combination with stylized movement passages, helping the student to discover their personal, human voice inside choreographed movement.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Increased strength, stretch, stamina, coordination, balance, understanding of basic terminology, ability to move in and out of the floor, articulation, alignment, musicality, increased sustained focus and confidence.
